title: Restart a service
content:
In some cases, you might need to restart a given service. For example, after making a configuration change, a service must be restarted for the change to take effect. 

Restart the ucmdb service

To restart the ucmdb service, follow these steps:

  1. Run the following command on a control plane node (embedded Kubernetes) or the bastion node (managed Kubernetes): 
    kubectl scale statefulset itom-ucmdb -n <namespace> --replicas=0

  2. Run the following command on a control plane node (embedded Kubernetes) or the bastion node (managed Kubernetes):

    kubectl scale statefulset itom-ucmdb -n <namespace> --replicas=<default replica number>

    The value of<default replica number> depends on the UD/UCMDB deployment size:

    • Large deployment: 3

    • Medium or small deployment: 2

Restart other UD/UCMDB services

Starting from Kubernetes 1.15, a new command is introduced to support rolling restart a service. In the containerized UD/UCMDB deployment, if you need to restart a service as part of an operation, you can do the following.

To restart a service, run the following command on a control plane node (embedded Kubernetes) or the bastion node (managed Kubernetes):

kubectl rollout restart <deployment/statfulset/ds> <resource name> -n <UD/UCMDB namespace>

Restart Data Flow Probe

To restart the Data Flow Probe, run the following command:

kubectl rollout restart deployment itom-ucmdb-probe -n <UD/UCMDB namespace>

Restart UCMDB UI

To restart UCMDB UI, run the following command:

kubectl rollout restart deployment itom-ucmdb-browser -n <UD/UCMDB namespace>

Restart UCMDB Gateway

To restart UCMDB Gateway, run the following command:

kubectl rollout restart deployment itom-ucmdb-gateway -n <UD/UCMDB namespace>
